parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2oa

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.62

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Multiplayer

</value></part><part><name>gr2 </name>=<value> Variables

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Send the variable value to the server - same limitations regarding variable type as [[publicVariable#Description|publicVariable]]. <br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>In Arma 3 it is possible to broadcast [[nil]] value</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''publicVariableServer''' varName

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> varName: [[String]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>'''publicVariableServer''' "CTFscoreOne";</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[publicVariable]], [[publicVariableClient]], [[addPublicVariableEventHandler]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on 24 Aug, 2012</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Kylania|Kylania]]<dd class="note">
[[publicVariableServer]] (run on client)<BR>
[[publicVariableClient]] (run on server)<BR>

Publishers the variable (name as STRING) to the server only. Useful when you want to synchronize a variable with the server but not any other clients. - [http://forums.bistudio.com/showthread.php?136494-ARMA-2-OA-beta-build-94209-(1-60-MP-compatible-build-post-1-60-release)&p=2179795&viewfull=1#post2179795 Rocket]

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
